_meanings:
{@--3@} To chain,
fetter.

{@--4@} To check, stop, suppress;
as in {#badDakopa, badDakozWa#} &c.

{@--7@} To fix or
set upon, direct towards (as the
yes or mind), cast upon (with
<ab>loc.</ab>); {#dfzwiM lakzyezu baDnan#} <ls>Mu. 1. 2</ls>;
<ls>R. 3. 4</ls>; <ls n="R.">6. 36</ls>; <ls>Bk. 20. 22.</ls>

{@--12@} To have,
possess, entertain, cherish, feel.
{@--13@} To punish, chastise.

{@--14@} To
offer, sacrifice (as an animal).

{@--15@}
To shut, close, stop.

{@--16@} To oppress,
overpower.
{@--17@} To join, unite.

{@--18@}
To produce, cause, effect.

{@--19@} To
strike (as root).

{@--20@} To display,
exhibit, show. (The senses of {#baMD#}
are variously modified according to
the noun with which it is 
connected; {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} {#BrukuwiM baMD#} to knit or bend
the eyebrows, to frown; {#muzwiM baMD#} to
clench the fist; {#aMjaliM baMD#} to fold
the hands together in supplication;
{#cittaM, --DiyaM, --manaH, --hfdayaM baMD#} to set the
heart on; {#prItiM, --BAvaM, --rAgaM baMD#} to fall
in love with, be enamoured of; {#setuM#}
{#baMD#} to construct or build a bridge;
{#vEraM baMD#} to conceive hatred, contract
enmity; {#saKyaM, sOhfda baMD#} to form
friendship; {#golaM baMD#} to form a globe;
{#maMqalaM baMD#} to form a circle, sit or
stand in a circle; {#mOnaM baMD#} to 
maintain silence; {#parikaraM -kakzAM baMD#} to
gird up one's loins, prepare 
oneself for anything; see the compounds
under {#badDa#} also).
